verses.kjv: The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
verses.ct: This is the message that came to Jeremiah from the LORD:

verses.kjv: Hear ye the words of this covenant, and speak unto the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem;
verses.ct: "Listen to the terms of this covenant, and then deliver them to the people of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And say thou unto them, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel; Cursed be the man that obeyeth not the words of this covenant,
verses.ct: Tell them this: The LORD, the God of Israel, says: A curse will fall on anyone who refuses to follow the terms of this covenant —

verses.kjv: Which I commanded your fathers in the day that I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, from the iron furnace, saying, Obey my voice, and do them, according to all which I command you: so shall ye be my people, and I will be your God:
verses.ct: the covenant I gave to your ancestors when I brought them out of Egypt, out of that iron furnace of suffering. I told them, 'Listen to me and carry out everything I command you. If you do, you will be my people, and I will be your God.'

verses.kjv: That I may perform the oath which I have sworn unto your fathers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, as it is this day. Then answered I, and said, So be it, O LORD.
verses.ct: I did this so I could fulfill the promise I made to your ancestors — to give them a land rich with milk and honey, which is the land you have today." I responded, "Let it be so, LORD."

verses.kjv: Then the LORD said unto me, Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying, Hear ye the words of this covenant, and do them.
verses.ct: Then the LORD told me, "Announce all of these words throughout the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem. Say to them: Listen to the terms of this covenant and carry them out.

verses.kjv: For I earnestly protested unto your fathers in the day that I brought them up out of the land of Egypt, even unto this day, rising early and protesting, saying, Obey my voice.
verses.ct: From the day I brought your ancestors out of Egypt until now, I have warned them again and again, persistently urging them, 'Listen to me.'

verses.kjv: Yet they obeyed not, nor inclined their ear, but walked every one in the imagination of their evil heart: therefore I will bring upon them all the words of this covenant, which I commanded them to do: but they did them not.
verses.ct: But they did not listen or pay attention. Instead, each one followed the stubbornness of their wicked hearts. So I brought on them every consequence spelled out in this covenant — the covenant I commanded them to keep, but which they ignored."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto me, A conspiracy is found among the men of Judah, and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Then the LORD said to me, "There is a conspiracy among the people of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: They are turned back to the iniquities of their forefathers, which refused to hear my words; and they went after other gods to serve them: the house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken my covenant which I made with their fathers.
verses.ct: They have returned to the sins of their earlier ancestors who refused to listen to my words. They have chased after other gods and worshiped them. Both the nation of Israel and the nation of Judah have violated the covenant I made with their ancestors."

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will bring evil upon them, which they shall not be able to escape; and though they shall cry unto me, I will not hearken unto them.
verses.ct: So the LORD says, "Pay attention — I am going to bring disaster on them that they will not be able to escape. Even when they cry out to me, I will not listen to them.

verses.kjv: Then shall the cities of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem go, and cry unto the gods unto whom they offer incense: but they shall not save them at all in the time of their trouble.
verses.ct: Then the towns of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem will go and cry out to the gods they've been burning incense to. But those gods will be completely powerless to rescue them in their time of trouble.

verses.kjv: For according to the number of thy cities were thy gods, O Judah; and according to the number of the streets of Jerusalem have ye set up altars to that shameful thing, even altars to burn incense unto Baal.
verses.ct: Judah, you have as many gods as you have towns, and the people of Jerusalem have set up altars on every street corner to that disgraceful idol — altars for burning incense to Baal.

verses.kjv: Therefore pray not thou for this people, neither lift up a cry or prayer for them: for I will not hear them in the time that they cry unto me for their trouble.
verses.ct: So do not pray for these people, and do not offer any plea or prayer on their behalf. I will not listen when they cry out to me because of their trouble."

verses.kjv: What hath my beloved to do in mine house, seeing she hath wrought lewdness with many, and the holy flesh is passed from thee? when thou doest evil, then thou rejoicest.
verses.ct: "What right does my beloved people have to be in my temple when they have committed so many wicked acts? Can sacred offerings remove your guilt? You celebrate even while doing evil."

verses.kjv: The LORD called thy name, A green olive tree, fair, and of goodly fruit: with the noise of a great tumult he hath kindled fire upon it, and the branches of it are broken.
verses.ct: The LORD once called you a beautiful olive tree, full of lush fruit. But now, with the roar of a violent storm, he has set it on fire, and its branches are shattered.

verses.kjv: For the LORD of hosts, that planted thee, hath pronounced evil against thee, for the evil of the house of Israel and of the house of Judah, which they have done against themselves to provoke me to anger in offering incense unto Baal.
verses.ct: The LORD of Armies, who planted you, has declared disaster against you because of the evil committed by both the nation of Israel and the nation of Judah. They brought this on themselves by provoking me with their incense offerings to Baal.

verses.kjv: And the LORD hath given me knowledge of it, and I know it: then thou shewedst me their doings.
verses.ct: The LORD revealed it to me, and I understood. He showed me what they were doing.

verses.kjv: But I was like a lamb or an ox that is brought to the slaughter; and I knew not that they had devised devices against me, saying, Let us destroy the tree with the fruit thereof, and let us cut him off from the land of the living, that his name may be no more remembered.
verses.ct: I had been like a gentle lamb led to the slaughterhouse. I had no idea they were plotting against me, saying, "Let's destroy the tree along with its fruit. Let's eliminate him from the land of the living so that no one even remembers his name."

verses.kjv: But, O LORD of hosts, that judgest righteously, that triest the reins and the heart, let me see thy vengeance on them: for unto thee have I revealed my cause.
verses.ct: But LORD of Armies, you judge with righteousness and you examine the deepest thoughts and motives of the heart. Let me witness your justice carried out against them, because I have placed my case in your hands.

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD of the men of Anathoth, that seek thy life, saying, Prophesy not in the name of the LORD, that thou die not by our hand:
verses.ct: So the LORD speaks about the men of Anathoth who are trying to kill you, saying, "Stop prophesying in the name of the LORD, or we will kill you with our own hands."

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD of hosts, Behold, I will punish them: the young men shall die by the sword; their sons and their daughters shall die by famine:
verses.ct: Therefore the LORD of Armies says, "Pay attention — I will punish them. Their young men will die in battle, and their sons and daughters will die from starvation.

verses.kjv: And there shall be no remnant of them: for I will bring evil upon the men of Anathoth, even the year of their visitation.
verses.ct: Not a single one of them will survive, because I will bring disaster on the men of Anathoth when the time comes for their punishment."
